poem:
Title: "The Harvest of Brexit"

Stone-making hands plough furrows,
Signals falter, moulding nations.
From foreign lands, ripe bounties pale,
Each berry's bloom shrinks beneath the hour.

A fifth of life, plucked from the vine
By slabs of bureaucratic decree,
The common bread grows sour.
UK's belly, once full, now starves
On a feast of sovereignty.
